intro: Sebastiania leptopoda, commonly known as the slender-seeded sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, glossy leaves. It produces distinctive, spiny fruits that contain seeds coated in a sticky, resinous substance. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
